intro: Ricotia pestalotiana, commonly known as the Brazilian star-of-Bahia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded or moist environments. Its leaves are alternate and have a velvety texture, while its stems are often hairy. It is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms.
